titleStmt.title: Here is co[n]teyned the lyfe of Iohan Picus erle of Myrandula a grete lorde of Italy an excellent connynge man in all sciences, [and] verteous of lyuynge with dyuers epystles [and] other werkes of ye sayd Iohan Picus full of grete science vertue [and] wysedome, whose lyfe [and] werkes bene worthy [and] dygne to be redde and often to be had in memorye.
Lyfe of Johan Picus erle of Myrandula. English
titleStmt.author: Pico della Mirandola, Giovanni Francesco, 1470-1533.
More, Thomas, Sir, Saint, 1478-1535.

publicationStmt.publisher: In the Fletestrete at the sygne of the Sonne, by me Wynkyn de worde,

notesStmt.note: By Giovanni Francesco Pico della Mirandola, the subject's nephew.
Translated by Sir Thomas More, whose name appears on A2r.
Printer's name and address from colophon; publication date estimated by STC.
Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
